content:
Attachment Audit Report No. 4-1711
- 2 -
CUSW/2D will be informed of the arrivals by BES. CUSA/2D then advises the recommended recipients to tako delivery from BES yard. Up.to March 8, 1962, altogether 196 ship- ments arrived since inception of the program. The inves- tigation revealed that no records regarding arrival, dis- position and inventory were available in CUS4/2D, although some files of the arrivals reported by BES and the copy of receipts submitted by recipients are being kept by CUSA Accounting Office. The CUSA/2D has no knowledge of the arrivals until they are informed by BES. Should the BES neglect or dolay to inform, CUSA 2D has no means to detect it. According to P/SP's memo of 2/26/62, 14 ea. of Welders and 1 box of spare parts procured under PIO/C No. 00200 for Taiwan Power Company and 2 ea. of Tank Fabric procured under PIO/C No. 00335 for Public Works Bureau were kept without informing CUSA of the arrival. These items were reported to CUSA leter, however, the efficiency of disposition may be affected by such delayed notice. It is suggested that the CUSA/2D should also be advised of the arrivals by CUSA/3D in order to check the correctness of the information reported by BES and that a proper inventory record should be kept by CUSA 2D for further effectiveness of disposition and better control of the properties.
2. Long-idle items: Quite a number of items procured under PIO/Cs 00043 & 80450 have been left-over in BES yard for over a year. According to CUSA such items are a portion of those which were forwarded either not requested or in excess of the requested quantities. CUSA requested the Mission per letter No. C3-61-2587 dated 7/29/61 that such properties be sold at a price lower than the floor prices and, if necessary, that these items may be sold as scrap in order to save un- necessary expenses. The request was approved by the Mission, however, nothing has been done to the effect. The auditor was advised by BES that an advisor of Shihmen Development Commission (SDC) has expressed the requirement of some of these items by SDC on his visit to BES with Mission PO. CUSA's expedient action to dispose of the long-idle items should be requested.
3. Storage conditions at BES yard: The storage conditions at BES yard were observed by PO on 2/20/62 and were indicated as unsatisfactory. A follow-up investigation conducted by the auditor on 3/8/62 disclosed that the conditions at BES yard remained the same. All proporties are stored in open air. Some items of heavy equipment are unprotected from the weather and are even showing rust. An improvement of the storage method should be made by BES.
C. Non-project typo excess property:
1. "Special Provisions" for disposal of the excess property: Pursuont to the "Special Provisions" set forth under PA Nos. 0220 & 1206 the excess property should first be offered to end-users in the public sector and then be auctioned to private enterprises in accordance with the following or der of priority:
(A) Construction and Earth Moving Equipment:
(1) Shihmen dam and hydro plants
(2) Public works, lumber
(3) Private construction companies
史饭
Academia Historica
75

tigation revealed that no records regarding arrival, dis-
position and inventory were available in CUS4/2D, although

arrivals until they are informed by BES. Should the BES

reported by BES and that a proper inventory record should

and better control of the properties.

a year. According to CUSA such items are a portion of those
which were forwarded either not requested or in excess of
the requested quantities. CUSA requested the Mission per

sold at a price lower than the floor prices and, if necessary,

necessary expenses. The request was approved by the Mission,

BES yard were observed by PO on 2/20/62 and were indicated
as unsatisfactory. A follow-up investigation conducted by
the auditor on 3/8/62 disclosed that the conditions at BES
yard remained the same. All proporties are stored in open
air. Some items of heavy equipment are unprotected from
the weather and are even showing rust. An improvement of
the storage method should be made by BES.
C. Non-project typo excess property:
1. "Special Provisions" for disposal of the excess property:
Pursuont to the "Special Provisions" set forth under PA Nos.
0220 & 1206 the excess property should first be offered to
end-users in the public sector and then be auctioned to

of priority:

(1) Shihmen dam and hydro plants
